conclusion: To determine the magnitude of the Ampere force acting on the entire wire frame, consider the forces on both the straight and curved parts.
The straight part of the wire frame is subjected to an Ampere force F due to the current I flowing through it in the presence of a magnetic field B. The length of the straight part is 2r.
The current I can be found using the relation F = BIL for the straight conductor, leading to I = F/(2rB).
The curved part of the wire frame is a semi-circle with radius r. The length of the curved part is πr.
The force on the curved part is calculated by integrating the force over the length of the semi-circle, resulting in F_curved = BI(πr).
Substitute I = F/(2rB) into the expression for F_curved to get F_curved = Fπ/2.
The total force on the wire frame is the sum of the forces on the straight and curved parts: F_total = F + Fπ/2 = F(1 + π/2).
